data.description: Purpose Support the execution of innovative media and marketing technology solutions across data, analytics, and engineering functions. This role is ideal for a curious, motivated individual who wants to learn by doing, contribute meaningfully to real projects, and gain exposure to how cutting-edge media and marketing operations run from the inside. Responsibilities Learn the Business of the Business Gain a foundational understanding of media, marketing, and performance advertising ecosystems. Participate in internal meetings to understand how data drives campaign planning, measurement, and optimization. Learn how various Attention Arc teams (data, strategy, media, and creative) collaborate to deliver value to clients. Support Data & Tech Initiatives Assist with QA and validation of campaign data pipelines, dashboards, and performance reports. Contribute to research projects and competitive audits related to emerging ad tech, data platforms, or AI/ML applications. Work alongside analytics and engineering team members to document, test, and improve internal tools and processes. Contribute to Real Work Participate in cross-functional sprint planning, daily standups, and retrospectives. Shadow analysts and technologists on key deliverables—such as client reporting, data audits, or platform integrations. Support special projects ranging from process automation to API research and tool evaluations. Competencies Curiosity & Learning Agility: Eager to learn, ask questions, and take on new challenges with minimal fear of failure. Analytical Thinking: Able to break problems down logically and support team members with structured thinking. Communication: Comfortable expressing ideas clearly—verbally and in writing—and asking for help when needed. Organization: Can keep track of multiple small assignments, manage time wisely, and follow through reliably. Collaboration: Works well in a team environment, respects diverse perspectives, and brings a positive attitude. Qualifications Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Marketing Analytics, Information Systems, etc.) Some experience with one or more of the following is a plus: Data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, Python, or R) Visualization platforms (Tableau, Looker, Google Data Studio) Marketing or web analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, etc.) Demonstrated interest in advertising/media, technology, or data-driven storytelling. Details Location: Remote-first or hybrid based on candidate’s location and preferencesDuration: Summer 2025 (8–10 weeks) Compensation: Paid internship, $18/hr
